definition: if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
(Tw) saddle horse/mounted soldier
to sit astride/to ride (a horse, bike etc)/classifier for saddle horses
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: He holds a wolf by the ears.
The circumstance in nowadays namely apt ride a tiger tough bottom.
sentences.chinese: 现在的情况就是骑虎难下。

sentences.english: I'm in a slightly awkward position, in that he is not arriving until the 10th.
sentences.chinese: 我有点骑虎难下，是因为他直到十号才能来。

sentences.english: Tom is really in a dilemma because he gave some rack commentaries about the current trend.
sentences.chinese: 因为对形势作了草率的评论，汤姆现在真是骑虎难下。

sentences.english: Tom is really in a dilemma because he gave some rash commentaries about the current trend.
sentences.chinese: 因为对形势作了草率的评论，汤姆现在真是骑虎难下。

sentences.english: Those who foolishly seek power by riding on the back of the tiger end up inside. John F, Kennnedy , American Puesident .
sentences.chinese: 那些愚蠢的追逐权利的人最终都闹得个骑虎难下。

sentences.english: You are on thin ice already.
sentences.chinese: 你现在已经骑虎难下了。

definition: no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless

lit. once you've shot the arrow, there's no getting it back (idiom)/fig. once you started sth, there's no turning back/to have to finish what one started/to be determined to reach one's goals in spite of setbacks
pinyin: kai1 gong1 mei2 you3 hui2 tou2 jian4

definition: lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
to crush one's own foot while trying to maneuver a rock (to a cliff edge, to drop on one's enemy) (idiom)/hoisted by one's own petard
pinyin: ban1 qi3 shi2 tou5 za2 zi4 ji3 de5 jiao3

definition: see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
as matters stand/things having reached this stage
lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom)/fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
to exhaust one's limited abilities (idiom)
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
